description.plain:
Leah Kalmenson (born September 9, 1992), famously known as Leah Kate, is an American electro-pop and pop-punk singer-songwriter born and raised in Los Angeles, California.

With a passion for music at a very early age, complemented with a very musical family owner of a radio and the dream to be a pop-star at the age of five, Kate already knew what she was going to with her life. She started taking voice lessons, which eventually led to the musician to post covers on her YouTube channel.

At the age of thirteen, knowing that her family “had the mentality that you should get a job and do music on the side”, Leah decided to start contacting producers through the emails she founded online, and got some responses, though nothing life-changing. So, with no other option but to do it herself, she moved to New York and, with a remote job, her music career was about to start.

“I See You”, her debut single, was released on May 25, 2018, a track that “didn’t come from the happiest place, but I turned it into something people could have a good time to” in words of the artist herself. The song was then followed by a few singles, like “WTF?”, released on March 22, 2019, or “So Good”, two months later, which both eventually would be included on Kate’s debut extended-play, Impulse, on mid-year.

As Leah came back to L.A. before the pandemic, all the effort from the past few years started to paying off as her back then first hit started to blow-up on TikTok. “Fuck Up the Friendship, with now over seventy million stream only on Spotify, has settled as one of the artist’s most popular songs from her career. It was released on June 11, 2020, as the second single of her sophomore EP, Used To This.

On 2021, after dropping her songs “Calabasas”, “Veronica” and “Shit Show”, the singer released what would be her last independent project to date, What Just Happened? on October 1.

With end of the WJH era, “Dear Denny” started to gained popularity and became the main reason why Kate was signed with 10k Projects.

“10 Things I Hate About You” was released on March 23, 2022, as her first song under the new label. It became her biggest hit to date going viral all over social media, especially on TikTok, and expanding her music to a whole new public that didn’t know about the American artist. The single was later included on her most recent and successful project, Alive And Unwell, along with “Monster”, “Hot All The Time” and “Life Sux”.

Kate has named No Doubt, Gwen Stefani, Avril Lavigne, blink-182 and Green Day as the biggest influences on her music.

Leah Kalmenson (born September 9, 1992), famously known as Leah Kate, is an American electro-pop and pop-punk singer-songwriter born and raised in Los Angeles, California.

With a passion for music at a very early age, complemented with a very musical family owner of a radio and the dream to be a pop-star at the age of five, Kate already knew what she was going to with her life. She started taking voice lessons, which eventually led to the musician to post covers on her YouTube channel.

At the age of thirteen, knowing that her family “had the mentality that you should get a job and do music on the side”, Leah decided to start contacting producers through the emails she founded online, and got some responses, though nothing life-changing. So, with no other option but to do it herself, she moved to New York and, with a remote job, her music career was about to start.

“I See You”, her debut single, was released on May 25, 2018, a track that “didn’t come from the happiest place, but I turned it into something people could have a good time to” in words of the artist herself. The song was then followed by a few singles, like “WTF?”, released on March 22, 2019, or “So Good”, two months later, which both eventually would be included on Kate’s debut extended-play, Impulse, on mid-year.

As Leah came back to L.A. before the pandemic, all the effort from the past few years started to paying off as her back then first hit started to blow-up on TikTok. “Fuck Up the Friendship, with now over seventy million stream only on Spotify, has settled as one of the artist’s most popular songs from her career. It was released on June 11, 2020, as the second single of her sophomore EP, Used To This.

On 2021, after dropping her songs “Calabasas”, “Veronica” and “Shit Show”, the singer released what would be her last independent project to date, What Just Happened? on October 1.

With end of the WJH era, “Dear Denny” started to gained popularity and became the main reason why Kate was signed with 10k Projects.

“10 Things I Hate About You” was released on March 23, 2022, as her first song under the new label. It became her biggest hit to date going viral all over social media, especially on TikTok, and expanding her music to a whole new public that didn’t know about the American artist. The single was later included on her most recent and successful project, Alive And Unwell, along with “Monster”, “Hot All The Time” and “Life Sux”.

Kate has named No Doubt, Gwen Stefani, Avril Lavigne, blink-182 and Green Day as the biggest influences on her music.

songs.full_title: 10 Things I Hate About You by Leah Kate
songs.title: 10 Things I Hate About You

description.plain:
“10 Things I Hate About You” is Leah Kate’s  first charting single. Kate wrote the song with Madi Yanofsky (Co-writer on Nessa Barrett’s “I Hope Ur Miserable Until Ur Dead,” and Jessie Murph’s “Look Who’s Cryin Now”) and Canadian producer Mike Wise, who also helped Kate pen the What Just Happened? track “F U Anthem.”

Lyrically, the song resembles the 2008 Miley Cyrus hit “7 Things,” listing reasons to hate a former lover. However, in both songs, the last item on the list is that the singer hates that they fell for the lover in the first place; making them fall in love.

Here, Leah Kate has caught her boyfriend cheating. Though she’s angry, she still has feelings for him, so she makes a list to remind herself of everything she hates about him.

songs.embed_content: Read “10 Things I Hate About You” by Leah Kate on Genius

songs.lyrics:
26 Contributors10 Things I Hate About You Lyrics[Verse 1]
I caught you cheating
You had the nerve to say you're sleepin', just not with her
But tell your friends that I'll be lost without you
And I'll admit it sometimes I miss when we were in it
So I made a list so I'll never forget all the things I hate about you

[Chorus]
Ten, you're selfish
Nine, you're jaded
Eight, the dumbest guy I've dated
Seven, talk a big game 'til you're naked
Only six seconds and I had to fake it
Five, you're toxic
Four, can't trust you
Three, you still got mommy issues
Two years of your bullshit I can't undo
One, I hate the fact that you made me love you
[Verse 2]
Your friends must suck if they think you're cool
A sloppy drunk obsessed with his Juul
Keep buying bottles with your daddy's money
And I don't know how I fell for your shit
You gross me out, now I've got the ick
And I've got a list of why you don't get to fuck me

[Chorus]
Ten, you're selfish
Nine, you're jaded
Eight, the dumbest guy I've dated
Seven, talk a big game 'til you're naked
Only six seconds and I had to fake it
Five, you're toxic
Four, can't trust you
Three, you still got mommy issues
Two years of your bullshit I can't undo
One, I hate the fact that you made me love you

[Bridge]
You made me love you
You made me love you
Ooh, oh, how'd you make me love you?
And I'll admit it, sometimes I miss when we were in it
So I made a list, yeah
Ten things I hate about you
You might also like[Chorus]
Ten, you're selfish
Nine, you're jaded
Eight, the dumbest guy I've dated
Seven, talk a big game 'til you're naked
Only six seconds and I had to fake it
Five, you're toxic
Four, can't trust you
Three, you still got mommy issues
Two years of your bullshit I can't undo
One, I hate the fact that you made me love you8Embed

songs.full_title: Fuck Up the Friendship by Leah Kate
songs.title: Fuck Up the Friendship

description.plain:
“Fuck Up the Friendship” is just about knowing that you can’t be friends with that person.

It’s having a feeling inside that you need to be more than that.

You want to screw up the feeling of friends, and start something new.

songs.full_title: Twinkle Twinkle Little Bitch by Leah Kate
songs.title: Twinkle Twinkle Little Bitch

description.plain: “Twinkle Twinkle” also known as “Twinkle Twinkle Little Bitch” was supposed to be the third single for Leah’s 4th Studio EP “Alive and Unwell” but was scrapped for unknown reasons, most likely due to the hate the song got. The song was first teased on May 5th, 2022 on TikTok where people had mixed opinions about it, the track was then released a month later on June 24th alongside a music video for the song, 5 days later she released a lyric video with BTS from the music video and cover art shoot.

songs.embed_content: Read “Twinkle Twinkle Little Bitch” by Leah Kate on Genius
